Overview Utilized JPL data to identify Martian surface frost. Trained a CNN model with EfficientNetB0, ResNet50, and VGG16 using transfer learning. Achieved a 91% accuracy with EfficientNetB0.
Key Steps Data Processing: Preprocessed JPL data, adjusting for lighting and normalizing sizes.
CNN Training: Developed a CNN model for automatic frost identification, employing data augmentation.
Transfer Learning: Fine-tuned EfficientNetB0, ResNet50, and VGG16 on Martian frost dataset.
Optimization: Achieved 91% accuracy with EfficientNetB0 through hyperparameter tuning.
Performance Evaluation: Evaluated models on a test set, analyzing metrics such as precision, recall and F1-score.
Deployment: Deployed EfficientNetB0 model for real-time Martian frost detection.
Outcome Successful application of ML techniques to JPL data, enhancing understanding of Martian surface conditions.
GitHub Link
summary: Developed a ML model using CNN And Transfer Learning to identify the frost in Martian HiRISE images on JPL dataset.
title: Martian Frost Detection Project

content:
This project was undertaken as part of my academic curriculum and involves a system for efficient classroom attendance management. The workflow is outlined below:
Teacher Sign-in:
The teacher starts by opening the mobile app and signing in using their unique teacher ID. Student Sign-in:
Students can sign in to the same application using their designated student ID. Attendance Marking:
The teacher initiates attendance by pressing a sound-emitting button on their smartphone. The emitted sound waves are received by the students‚Äô smartphones, marking their attendance once received. Technology Stack The project incorporates the following technologies:
Development Platform: Android Studio Programming Language: Java Database Management: MySQL (for storing student records) Security: RSA Encryption Algorithm (to maintain the confidentiality of student data)
summary: This system is designed to reduce the time taken to mark attendance of students in colleges.
title: Smart Attendence System using Sound waves

This project was undertaken during the Gujarat Industrial Hackathon conducted on March 21, 2019. The primary focus was on enhancing the video quality of surveillance cameras at night through the implementation of a machine learning model. The project details are as follows:
Objective:
Designing a machine learning model to improve the video quality captured by surveillance cameras during nighttime. Implementation:
Utilized the Python programming language for project implementation. Worked with computer vision libraries in Python to develop a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN). Training Process:
Trained the model by processing each frame of a video footage and implementing denoising techniques. Outcome:
Produced a clarified video output, enhancing visibility, particularly useful for emergency situations and law enforcement. Technology Stack The technologies employed in this project include:
Programming Language: Python Machine Learning Model: Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) Computer Vision Libraries: OpenCV, NumPy, Matplotlib, SciPy.
title: Image denoising Using CNN

This project was accomplished during the Gujarat Industrial Hackathon held on February 12, 2018. It successfully qualified for the final round, surpassing 500+ participating teams. The objective of the project was to enhance the efficiency of the shopping experience by associating RFID tags with every product in the mall. The system‚Äôs workflow is outlined below:
Customer Checkout:
After completing their shopping, customers proceed to the billing counter. RFID-Based Scanning:
The billing counter is equipped with an RFID-based door. As customers pass through, all items are automatically scanned using RFID tags. Automatic Billing:
The total cost of all scanned items is displayed, and customers can make the payment, reducing the time spent on manual scanning. Technology Stack The technologies used in developing this system include:
RFID Scanner: Arduino UNO Programming Language: C (for coding Arduino UNO) RFID Technology: RFID Chips Database Management: MySQL (for storing customer records)
summary: Implemented in mall to reduce the waiting time of customer while doing checkout.
title: RFID-based smart mall
